metadata.synopsis:
The dwarf was turned to stone by the hag to stop the spread of an deadly disease - Laduguer's Bite. Little does he know that the hag was the one who cause the disease in the first place.

Should you remove the petrification spell BEFORE the hag is dead, the disease will kill him.

Should you speak to him after the hag is dead, you can figure out that the hag is the one who made him sick in the first place.

17.speaker: Efrin
17.text: Ungh... what... argh... what in the bloody hells is going on?
17.context: NodeContext: You were turned to stone and you're just coming out of it. Dazed, confused, touching your head.

61.speaker: Player
61.context: NodeContext: Player has said they're here to help. You're relived and still putting the piece together. Grateful and happy.

75.speaker: Efrin
75.text: Help? You bloody Duergar gave me the Bite! But... the way I feel...
75.context: NodeContext: Player has said they're here to help. You're relived and still putting the piece together. Grateful and happy.

64.speaker: Efrin
64.text: How did you cure it? The Bite?
64.context: NodeContext: You have an incurable disease and you can't believe they player managed to fix it (spoiler: they didn't)

99.speaker: Player
99.text: Laduguer's Bite? How'd you catch it?
99.context: NodeContext: Spitting the word. These are your enemies and you were dying because of them.

51.speaker: Efrin
51.text: The duergar, of course. Filthy greylings.
51.context: NodeContext: Spitting the word. These are your enemies and you were dying because of them.

63.speaker: Efrin
63.text: I was on death's door when the hag cast... wait. You didn't - you didn't cure the Bite?
63.context: NodeContext: Panic ramps up, tinted by rage. Turn the accusations on the player.

131.speaker: Efrin
131.text: Gods, r-really? I thought I was dead. I was sure...  thank you. Thank you so much.
131.context: NodeContext: Player has said they're here to help. You're relived and still putting the piece together. Grateful and happy.

2.speaker: Player
2.context: NodeContext: Player has removed a spell that prevented you from dying. Panic and rage as you try to explain.

52.speaker: Efrin
52.text: You did what? But - but you can't!
52.context: NodeContext: Player has removed a spell that prevented you from dying. Panic and rage as you try to explain.

126.speaker: Player
126.context: NodeContext: You have an incurable disease and the player has basically condemned you to death. You start to freak out as you realise the implications.

104.speaker: Efrin
104.text: I've the bloody Bite! Laduguer's Bite! The petrification stopped it spreading...
104.context: NodeContext: You have an incurable disease and the player has basically condemned you to death. You start to freak out as you realise the implications.

132.speaker: Player
132.text: You should be grateful. I expect payment.
132.context: NodeContext: You have an incurable disease and the player has basically condemned you to death. You start to freak out as you realise the implications.

58.speaker: Efrin
58.text: Grateful? I've got Laduguer's Bite! I'm dying! Why else do you think I was petrified?
58.context: NodeContext: You have an incurable disease and the player has basically condemned you to death. You start to freak out as you realise the implications.

9.speaker: Efrin
9.context: NodeContext: Panic ramps up, tinted by rage. You're about to die and you know it.

78.speaker: Player
78.context: NodeContext: Your memories are coming back. You remember going to the hag for a spell to save you.

81.speaker: Efrin
81.text: I - I remember that bit. I think. She...  turned me to stone. Because of the Bite! Of course.
81.context: NodeContext: Your memories are coming back. You remember going to the hag for a spell to save you.

124.speaker: Efrin
124.text: I can't believe you fixed it. How did you cure me?
124.context: NodeContext: . You have an incurable disease and you can't believe they player managed to fix it (spoiler: they didn't)

55.speaker: Player
55.context: NodeContext: You have an incurable disease and the player has basically condemned you to death. You start to freak out as you realise the implications.

149.speaker: Efrin
149.text: Laduguer's  Bite? I caught it when - wait. You didn't... you didn't fix it?
149.context: NodeContext: You have an incurable disease and the player has basically condemned you to death. You start to freak out as you realise the implications.

86.speaker: Efrin
86.text: Why would you turn me back if you didn't -
86.context: NodeContext: Panic ramps up, tinted by rage. Turn the accusations on the player.

144.speaker: Player
144.text: I fixed your petrification - nothing else.
144.context: NodeContext: Player has asked about your disease and was it contagious. You're surprised and confused by the question.

6.speaker: Player
6.context: NodeContext: Player has asked about your disease and was it contagious. You're surprised and confused by the question.

130.speaker: Efrin
130.text: Well - yes. Why d'ya bloody think I'm here?
130.context: NodeContext: Player has asked about your disease and was it contagious. You're surprised and confused by the question.

83.speaker: Efrin
83.text: Oh, no, no. Why - why did you remove the spell if ya couldn't fix me?!
83.context: NodeContext: Panic ramps up, tinted by rage. You realise the player hasn't cured you of a horrible and contagious disease you have - they've condemned you to death.

121.speaker: Player
121.text: What kind of fool would make a pact with a hag?
121.context: NodeContext: The player has been condescending to you. You went to a hag to save your life. Angry and embarassed.

125.speaker: Efrin
125.text: I had no bloody choice! I'm dying!
125.context: NodeContext: The player has been condescending to you. You went to a hag to save your life. Angry and embarassed.

48.speaker: Efrin
48.text: She petrified me to stop it from spreading until - oh no.
48.context: NodeContext: You realise the player didn't cure you. They've condemned you to death. Panic rising. Frightened.

115.speaker: Efrin
115.context: CinematicNodeContext: Choking a little - gripping his stomach. Reaching forward with one hand - as if to grab the player. NodeContext: Chokes a little - as if about to vomit. You're dying. Panic and fear ramped up to the max.

76.speaker: Efrin
76.text: I don't want to die, I - *retch*
76.context: CinematicNodeContext: |Cinematic - clutches stomach as he vomits. He collapses on the ground - dead. in a pool of his own blood and vomit. NodeContext: Crying, freaking out, leaning over and vomiting horribly as they collapse on the ground.

40.speaker: Player
40.text: I've heard tales of Laduguer's Bite. Don't your insides end up on your outside?
40.context: NodeContext: You have an incurable disease and the player has basically condemned you to death. You start to freak out as you realise the implication - the player hasn't cured you.

37.speaker: Efrin
37.text: The very one. Complete with everything from sores to vomitin' blood. By the time it kills you it - wait.
37.context: NodeContext: You have an incurable disease and the player has basically condemned you to death. You start to freak out as you realise the implication - the player hasn't cured you.

94.speaker: Efrin
94.text: You didn't fix it? Oh no.
94.context: NodeContext: Panic ramps up, tinted by rage. Turn the accusations on the player as they realise they haven't

53.speaker: Efrin
53.context: CinematicNodeContext: Custom Cam - Tilt Up + RotationNodeContext: You were turned to stone and you're just coming out of it. Dazed, confused, touching your head.

84.speaker: Efrin
84.text: Oh no. No. Why ain't I petrified?
84.context: NodeContext: Panic as you realise the petrification - the thing keeping a deadly disease from spreading across your body - is gone.

5.speaker: Player
5.context: NodeContext: Player has said the hag is dead - which means so should you. You're shocked.

69.speaker: Efrin
69.text: What?! How... how am I still breathin'?
69.context: NodeContext: Player has said the hag is dead - which means so should you. You're shocked.

118.speaker: Efrin
118.context: NodeContext: Confused as you look down at your hands and body - feeling fine. You're trying to make sense of everything.

77.speaker: Player
77.context: NodeContext: Wincing as you described the horrific disease. Think the Black Plague.

30.speaker: Efrin
30.text: I wouldn't wish it on anyone. Yer insides... end up on the outside. Petrification stops the spread.
30.context: NodeContext: Wincing as you described the horrific disease. Think the Black Plague.

141.speaker: Efrin
141.text: I was on death's door. But now I feel... I feel great.
141.context: NodeContext: You're grateful tp be alive but also completely confused.

122.speaker: Player
122.text: Search for any sign of Laduguer's Bite.
122.context: NodeContext: Player can't figure out why you're fine now. You don't want to look at it too closely. Grateful to be alive.

35.speaker: Player
35.text: Look for remnants of the hag's magic.
35.context: NodeContext: Player can't figure out why you're fine now. You don't want to look at it too closely. Grateful to be alive.

71.speaker: Narrator
71.text: *You can't detect anything. You have no explanation for his good health.*
71.context: NodeContext: Player can't figure out why you're fine now. You don't want to look at it too closely. Grateful to be alive.

42.text: *You can't detect anything. You have no explanation for his good health.*
42.context: NodeContext: Player can't figure out why you're fine now. You don't want to look at it too closely. Grateful to be alive.

88.speaker: Narrator
88.text: *You can't detect anything. You have no explanation for his good health.*
88.context: NodeContext: Player can't figure out why you're fine now. You don't want to look at it too closely. Grateful to be alive.

106.speaker: Efrin
106.text: I s'pose I should count my blessings. Most ain't so lucky.
106.context: NodeContext: Player can't figure out why you're fine now. You don't want to look at it too closely. Grateful to be alive.

32.speaker: Efrin
32.text: Look, greyling or not, you having a look put my mind at ease.
32.context: NodeContext: Gratitude - you are only alive because of the player.

109.speaker: Efrin
109.text: Not enough to hang around here, mind, but... thank you. And best of luck.

135.speaker: Efrin
135.text: I don't fancy hangin' around here. But... thank you. And best of luck.
135.context: NodeContext: Gratitude - you are only alive because of the player.

148.speaker: Player
148.text: Examine him for signs of Laduguer's Bite.
148.context: NodeContext: Dawning realisation that the hag did this to you in the first place. Mounting horror.

0.speaker: Player
0.text: Examine him for signs of Laduguer's Bite.
0.context: NodeContext: Dawning realisation that the hag did this to you in the first place. Mounting horror.

74.speaker: Narrator
74.text: *Not only is the disease gone, you see it's left no scars - an impossibility for the Bite.*
74.context: NodeContext: Dawning realisation that the hag did this to you in the first place. Mounting horror.

116.speaker: Narrator
116.text: *Not only is the disease gone, you see it's left no scars - an impossibility for the Bite.*
116.context: NodeContext: Dawning realisation that the hag did this to you in the first place. Mounting horror.

103.speaker: Efrin
103.text: What? But that doesn't make a lick of sense. Unless...
103.context: NodeContext: Dawning realisation that the hag did this to you in the first place. Mounting horror.

18.text: *As far as you can tell, he's in perfectly good health.*

28.speaker: Narrator
28.text: *As far as you can tell, he's in perfectly good health.*

67.speaker: Player
67.text: In the tales, hags always cook up their victim's misery first, then sell them false hope.
67.context: NodeContext: Dawning realisation that the hag did this to you in the first place. Mounting horror.

25.speaker: Efrin
25.context: NodeContext: Dawning realisation that the hag did this to you in the first place. Mounting horror.

13.speaker: Efrin
13.context: NodeContext: Spitting the words - you're furious.

44.speaker: Efrin
44.text: She made me sick.  And then trapped me in stone for kicks.
44.context: NodeContext: This is shocking realisation - you nearly died because you trusted the hag.

65.speaker: Player
65.text: I'm sorry this happened to you.
65.context: NodeContext: The reality of your situation is dawning on you - you may have missed out on the entirety of your children's lives - for nothing.

119.speaker: Efrin
119.text: I left me wife, me kids behind, for fear of infecting them. They were only babes.
119.context: NodeContext: The reality of your situation is dawning on you - you may have missed out on the entirety of your children's lives - for nothing.

100.speaker: Efrin
100.text: The stones know how old they are now.

15.speaker: Player
15.text: How long were you trapped like this?
15.context: NodeContext: The reality of your situation is dawning on you - you may have missed out on the entirety of your children's lives - for nothing.

59.speaker: Efrin
59.text: I - I don't know. Days? Years?
59.context: NodeContext: The reality of your situation is dawning on you - you may have missed out on the entirety of your children's lives - for nothing.

14.speaker: Efrin
14.text: My kids were only babes when I left. The stones know how old they are now.

123.speaker: Player
123.text: Focus on the positive. At least now you'll see them again.
123.context: NodeContext: Usually a gruff man, it is difficult for you to truly express how thankful and grateful you are - but you're trying.

133.speaker: Efrin
133.context: NodeContext: Usually a gruff man, it is difficult for you to truly express how thankful and grateful you are - but you're trying.

136.speaker: Efrin
136.text: I... I ain't got no way to repay you.

105.speaker: Player
105.text: Hopefully they've grown. Children are disgusting.
105.context: NodeContext: Player has said children are gross. A knowing smile as you think of your own. Love in your voice.

87.speaker: Efrin
87.text: Heh. I thought the same, 'til I held me own in my arms.
87.context: NodeContext: Player has said children are gross. A knowing smile as you think of your own. Love in your voice.

129.speaker: Efrin
129.text: I'll get to see them again, hold 'em again, 'cause of you. I - I ain't got not way to repay you.
129.context: NodeContext: Usually a gruff man, it is difficult for you to truly express how thankful and grateful you are - but you're trying.

41.speaker: Player
41.text: Listen, I have places to be.
41.context: NodeContext: Trying to pull yourself together after getting emotional - unusual for you.

8.speaker: Efrin
8.text: Sorry - now ain't the time for blathering.
8.context: NodeContext: Trying to pull yourself together after getting emotional - unusual for you.

43.speaker: Player
43.text: But now you have many more years ahead of you.
43.context: NodeContext: Determined - you're gonna find your kids and fast.

22.speaker: Efrin
22.text: True. And I don't plan to waste a moment more.
22.context: NodeContext: Determined - you're gonna find your kids and fast.

146.speaker: Player
146.text: Why would you wish to meet your spawn?
146.context: NodeContext: Surprised at the player's reaction - you wonder if they've ever had a family to call their own.

140.speaker: Efrin
140.context: NodeContext: Surprised at the player's reaction - you wonder if they've ever had a family to call their own.

114.speaker: Efrin
114.text: Tell you what, you ever come by my way? You've a seat at my dinner table.
114.context: NodeContext: Friendly and warm. You feel for the player.

113.speaker: Efrin
113.text: I... only wish I could do more to repay you.
113.context: NodeContext: Usually a gruff man, it is difficult for you to truly express how thankful and grateful you are - but you're trying.

80.speaker: Player
80.text: Don't worry. I didn't help just to get a reward.
80.context: NodeContext: Stern but kind - you're determined to pay the player back -one day

139.speaker: Efrin
139.text: No - what you've done for me and mine today won't be forgotten.
139.context: NodeContext: Stern but kind - you're determined to pay the player back -one day

23.speaker: Player
23.text: Damn it. You could've said as much from the start.
23.context: NodeContext: Stern but kind - you're determined to pay the player back -one day

19.speaker: Efrin
19.text: I'll find another way. I swear to you.
19.context: NodeContext: Stern but kind - you're determined to pay the player back -one day

134.speaker: Efrin
134.context: NodeContext: Voice thick with emotion as you think of your family - and that you'll see them again soon.

1.speaker: Player
1.text: Oh, you'll figure it out. You owe me a debt, and I intend to collect.
1.context: NodeContext: Stern but kind - you're determined to pay the player back -one day

20.speaker: Efrin
20.text: You won't be left wanting. You've my word.
20.context: NodeContext: Stern but kind - you're determined to pay the player back -one day

45.speaker: Player
45.text: I'm almost impressed - that's evil, even by a hag's standards.

96.speaker: Efrin
96.text: Evil don't begin to cover it.

73.speaker: Player
73.text: Attune with your blood and search him for magic.
73.context: NodeContext: Dawning realisation that the hag did this to you in the first place. Mounting horror.

91.speaker: Player
91.text: I can feel the hag's magic on you - it tastes of sickness.
91.context: NodeContext: Dawning realisation that the hag did this to you in the first place. Mounting horror.

97.speaker: Efrin
97.text: What? Are you sayin' it wasn't the Bite? But... bloody hells.
97.context: NodeContext: Dawning realisation that the hag did this to you in the first place. Mounting horror.

68.speaker: Player
68.text: Mordenkainen warns us that hags often cause their victims' tragedies.
68.context: NodeContext: Dawning realisation that the hag did this to you in the first place. Mounting horror.

56.speaker: Efrin
56.context: NodeContext: Dawning realisation that the hag did this to you in the first place. Mounting horror.

21.speaker: Player
21.text: Examine him for signs of magic.
21.context: NodeContext: Dawning realisation that the hag did this to you in the first place. Mounting horror.

107.speaker: Narrator
107.text: *You detect traces of decaying magic within him. Likely the cause of his disease.*
107.context: NodeContext: Dawning realisation that the hag did this to you in the first place. Mounting horror.

150.speaker: Efrin
150.text: But that doesn't make a lick of sense. The Bite ain't magical. Unless...
150.context: NodeContext: Dawning realisation that the hag did this to you in the first place. Mounting horror.

70.speaker: Efrin
70.context: NodeContext: Spitting the words - you're furious.

36.speaker: Player
36.text: No time for questions. Get out of here while you still can.
36.context: NodeContext: Gratitude - you are only alive because of the player.

85.speaker: Efrin
85.text: Yer right. And look... thank you. I don't know how you pulled it off - but thank you.
85.context: NodeContext: Gratitude - you are only alive because of the player.

47.speaker: Player
47.context: NodeContext: Said sadly - it was a difficult choice and one you struggled with.

108.speaker: Efrin
108.text: Why d'ya think I'm here? The hag petrified me. Only way to stop it.
108.context: NodeContext: Said sadly - it was a difficult choice and one you struggled with.

12.speaker: Player
12.text: You struck a deal with the hag, didn't you?
12.context: NodeContext: Said sadly - it was a difficult choice and one you struggled with.

142.speaker: Efrin
142.text: I had to. I was sick. Real sick. The hag petrified me - to stop it spreading.
142.context: NodeContext: Said sadly - it was a difficult choice and one you struggled with.

54.speaker: Player
54.text: The Bite's a terrible disease. I can see why you went to the hag.
54.context: NodeContext: You're speaking to someone who knows of the disease.

102.speaker: Efrin
102.text: Right? It was that or die covered in me own insides. It's why she petrified me - to stop the spread.
102.context: NodeContext: You're speaking to someone who knows of the disease.

117.speaker: Player
117.context: NodeContext: Said sadly - it was a difficult choice and one you struggled with. You're speaking to someone who knows of the disease.

90.speaker: Efrin
90.text: Why d'ya think I came to the hag? It was get petrified... or end up covered in me own insides.
90.context: NodeContext: Said sadly - it was a difficult choice and one you struggled with. You're speaking to someone who knows of the disease.

27.speaker: Player
27.text: Ha! The Bite should have turned you inside out by now.

145.speaker: Efrin
145.text: Better dead than a greyling. Why d'ya think we call it Laduguer's Bite? After that slaver of a god you adore?

95.speaker: Efrin
95.text: Because nothing disgusts us more than you lot.

7.speaker: Efrin
7.text: Argh. The stones take you, you disgusting half-breed. I'll deal with this myself.

112.speaker: Player
112.text: We 'greylings' know the Bite well - ask nicely, and I'll see how long you've got left.

128.speaker: Efrin
128.text: I... could you have a look?

72.speaker: Efrin
72.text: Could you have a look... please.

147.speaker: Player
147.text: Changed my mind. Enjoy tripping over your own guts.

93.speaker: Player
93.context: NodeContext: You should be dead. You have an incurable disease. You're trying to make sense of everything.

49.speaker: Player
49.text: Because I saved you. You're welcome.
49.context: NodeContext: You should be dead. You have an incurable disease. You're trying to make sense of everything.

120.speaker: Efrin
120.text: But - but how? The hag said there was no cure.
120.context: NodeContext: You should be dead. You have an incurable disease. You're trying to make sense of everything.

34.speaker: Efrin
34.text: And that the Bite... Laduguer's Bite was fatal.
34.context: NodeContext: Confused as you look down at your hands and body - feeling fine.

62.speaker: Player
62.text: You don't sound pleased. Would you rather be a statue?
62.context: NodeContext: You have an incurable disease - admitting it with worry and shame.

57.speaker: Efrin
57.text: I - I have the Bite. Laduguer's Bite.
57.context: NodeContext: You have an incurable disease - admitting it with worry and shame.

11.speaker: Efrin
11.text: How... how am I still breathin'?
11.context: NodeContext: Confused as you look down at your hands and body - feeling fine. You're trying to make sense of everything.

60.speaker: Efrin
60.text: I'm getting out of this hellhole. You'd best do the same.
60.context: NodeContext: You're alive but that could change at any moment. Nearly running out the door.

66.speaker: Efrin
66.context: CinematicNodeContext: Custom Cam - Tilt Up + RotationNodeContext: You were turned to stone and you're just coming out of it. Dazed, confused, touching your head.
